1.text: option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage.

3.text: This is a regression since rc1 and a deviation from javac.

4.text: I am guessing this may have to do something with change in the underlying Eclipse compiler.

5.text: Create a class in a subpackage such as: package subpackage;  public class Test {     public static void main(String[] args) { 	System.out.println("Hello");     } }  Then compile using following command: > ajc subpackage\Test.java  You will see a directory "subpackage" created under the existing "subpackage" directory.

6.text: The test.class is then put in subpackage\subpackage directory.

7.text: This means running java command results in  Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test  Running either of the following command fixes the problem: > ajc -d .

8.text: subpackage\Test.java  or   > javac subpackage\Test.java  No big deal, really.

9.text: But it will be nice to have same behavior as javac.
